p: Estimation of the feasible binding geometries and interactions between drugs and active site of proteins (Matin, Bhattacharjee, et al., 2019; Matin, Bhuiyan, et al., 2019) is obtained from molecular docking (Ghosh et al., 2020). Molecular docking score of esters 4– 15 along with standard antibiotic ampicillin (AMP) and hydroxychloroquine (HCQ) are shown in Table 8. We calculated docking score (binding affinity) of 13– 14, as these chlorobenzoyl compounds showed promising antifungal activities, with lanosterol 14α-demethylase (CYP51A1) and A. flavus (1R51) while all the uridine esters were considered for COVID-19 main protease (7BQY). In addition, other uridine esters 4– 12 expressed, in average, somewhat lower docking score than 13– 14 against CYP51A1 and 1R51.
